alert.note: Alert for Loudon; McMinn; Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 4:43PM CDT until August 05 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Loudon County in east Tennessee... East Central McMinn County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Monroe County in east Tennessee... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 543 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain are estimated to have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Madisonville, Etowah, Englewood, Vonore, Greenback, Fort Loudon State Park and Tellico Village. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
